alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 07 at 8:21PM EST until March 07 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 900 PM EST. * At 821 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lanesville to near Grahamsville, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Phoenicia and Mount Tremper around 825 PM EST. Woodstock and West Shokan around 830 PM EST. Saugerties, Olivebridge, West Hurley, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Saugerties South and Tillson around 835 PM EST. Kingston, Hurley, Lake Katrine and Port Ewen around 840 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Cherrytown, Tuckers Corner, Rolling Meadows, Maple Hill, Glenford, Atwood, Manorville, Katsbaan, Shultis Corners and Sweet Meadows. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
